column1: #Text=Polycrystalline samples with nominal Fe concentrations between Fe3.10GeTe2 and Fe2.60GeTe2 were prepared by grinding Fe powder, Ge powder, and Te shot in a He filled glove box.
#Text=The mixture was transferred, under He, to a vacuum line where the quartz ampoule was sealed under vacuum.
#Text=The samples were heated at 675◦C for approximately 10 d.
#Text=The as-reacted Fe3−xGeTe2 samples were found to be either slightly sintered and dull black for small x, or heavily sintered with visible grain growth/crystallization for large x.
#Text=At this point, the samples were analyzed with x-ray diffraction and magnetization measurements.
#Text=Small pellets were then fired briefly at 600◦C to facilitate isothermal magnetization and energy dispersive spectroscopy (EDS) measurements.
#Text=EDS measurements were performed using a Bruker Quantax 70 EDS system on a Hitachi TM-3000 microscope.
